results.description: Chip Design in Eastern MA is a Meetup of... well, folks interested in chip design in Eastern MA. We'll focus on digital synchronous (clocked) logic design. All experience levels are welcome. Some topics will be appropriate for beginners, some for experts. Topics may include: digital logic and FPGA design techniques and considerations, interesting research and innovations, open source projects, Hardware Design Languages (Verilog, VHDL, SystemC, TLM, BlueSpec, ...), industry practices and design methodologies, etc. The organizer, Steve Hoover, is an 18-year veteran chip designer (DEC, Compaq, Intel), now CEO of Redwood EDA (redwoodeda.com) bringing Transaction-Level Verilog (TL-Verilog) (TL-X.org) tools to the industry. Steve will lead general chip design topics as well as topics specific to TL-Verilog, and will invite expert guests to speak on other topics.
results.name: Chip Design in Eastern MA

Join other local writers as we take a break from our busy, noisy lives to write quietly together in a distraction-free environment. Initially, we'll be in Braintree, Massachusetts (which is why I've changed the group name in honor of the nearby Blue Hills reservation south of Boston). Later, we may meet in Natick, Massachusetts, or other locations.

Our group is open to adult writers (you must be 18+ to join; younger teens are welcome to attend as the guests of adult members). Typically, our Meetups begin with introductions and a few creative prompts. Then we'll spend the rest of our time writing in companionable silence, with occasional breaks. Toward the end of the Meetup, we'll invite people to share what they've written, if they wish. Our venues have everything we need: private rooms with tables and chairs, restrooms, kitchenettes, and free parking. We provide extension cords and power strips for laptops and creative-writing guides for onsite inspiration.

Down the road, we may offer writing workshops, but for now, the focus is on simply gathering to write. Signing up for events is easy. Just join this Meetup group (membership is free). Then RSVP "yes" for the events that interest you. Hope to see you soon.

results.description:
Chi siamo? 

Un gruppo di Italiani residenti a Boston 

Cosa facciamo? 

Ogni tre settimane ci incontriamo a cena per scambiare informazioni, idee e opinioni sulla politica nazionale e internazionale Italiana. 

Quali obiettivi abbiamo? 

Ci interessa approfondire la conoscenza della politica Italiana attraverso la lente offertaci dalla nostra posizione di osservatori residenti all’estero. Attraverso una costruttiva discussione, ci piacerebbe contribuire al miglioramento della qualita’ della vita in Italia. 

Come fare per partecipare al forum? 

Chiunque puo’ partecipare al forum. Se ti interessa esplorare questo forum, fai RSVP per il prossimo appuntamento. Per una discussione piu’ interessante, ti incoraggiamo ad informarti leggendo articoli, guardando video, e leggendo o scrivendo commenti su questo forum. 

Come e’ strutturata la serata? 

• Mezz’ora per salutarci e ordinare cena (Di norma ci incontriamo in un ristorante)

• Un’ora di discussione su un tema scelto durante la settimana precedente all’incontro 

• Un’ora di discussione su temi vari di piu’ recente cronaca proposti la sera stessa dai partecipanti 

• Varie ed eventuali


Quali sono le regole per la discussione? 

Come primo passo, chiediamo a tutti di riconoscere che la realta’ e’ complessa e che di norma il cervello umano riesce a comprenderne solo pezzettini. Avere questa consapevolezza permette di gestire la discussione come un processo costruttivo di scambio di idee anziche’ solo contrapposizione di opinioni. Di seguito sono alcuni indicatori che pensiamo aiutino a mantenere la discussione nell’ambito di uno scambio costruttivo di idee: 

1.  Apprezzare la diversita’ di idee

2.  Basare la discussion su fatti e numeri 

3.  Sforzarsi di capire il punto di vista degli altri 

4.  Criticare i fatti e le politiche, non le persone o i politici 

5.  Dare a tutti la possibilita' di parlare 

6.  Promuovere un clima di amicizia 

(Adattato da: http://ctb.ku.edu/en/table-of-contents/leadership/group-facilitation/group-discussions/main)
results.name: Forum Di Politica Italiana

results.description:
Finally they confirmed my diagnosis of metastatic cancer; which I have always known but secretly hope that I might be wrong..... Now what? Well, there are admirable ladies who can handle cancer diagnoses with grace and compassion; not for themselves solely but mostly for the sake of people around them. They are my idols but I knew from the get-go that I am absolutely not yet one of them. I want to scream, throw a tantrum, kicking up like a baby while whining and sobbing and swearing on the floor. I don't act like this all the time though because it requires a bit physical strength. Never less, I believe that we ladies have the right to react to cancer however we wish to, and those superheroes need a break every now and then too. So I started this group with one goal in mind- for my fellow lady cancer carriers to be openly emotional, freely expressional, and swear at cancer until we exhausted all dirty words we know, then we go shopping and eating and dancing like no tomorrow. And then, we gather ourselves and get on with our ordinary life and live as healthy as anyone can be , until the next meetup. :)

Yup, our menu includes screaming exercise (a.k.a Friday night dance club), anger management (a.k.a boxing with the cute gym coach), stress release exercise (a.k.a swearing phrase spelling bee, crying competition), group field trips (e.g. reiki, craniosacral therapy, princess spa, hair shedding shower, wig fitting party), and world peace, seriously (a.k.a trips around the USA and the world to drag our fellow cancer carriers out of their shells or their superhero masks, and share a lot of FUN and SHIT dealing with cancer! Or anything you disparately need a group support, just holler!
results.name: I've Got Cancer, LOL- Boston

results.description:
We started our first meetup group in San Francisco back in March 2012.  It now has over 7,000 members (14,000 in all the Bay Area).  With the success of our events, this year we're expanding to the Boston, MA!

Our goal is to provide a fun low-pressure environment/activity where individuals can connect one-on-one. Sometimes it's intimidating to go to a group activity all by yourself. Or sometimes you get lost in a big group event – you talk to everyone but get to know no one. Wouldn't it be nice to have a date at a fun event?

With our activities, you're welcome to come alone or with a date. And if you need a date, visit HowAboutADate.com. (1) post a date - what, when, & where, (2) review replies, (3) choose your date and go out. Dating Simplified! Do what you love... and love will find you.

Yes, this is a different Meetup group – it combines great activities with (optionally) bringing a date for that activity. We simply want you to have a great time (i.e. enjoy fun dates not "interview dates" or high pressure dates). And feel free to suggest great "first date" activities and even post links to other great meetup events. We're not here to compete with other meetups, only to support and enrich the Singles Community!

There is no age requirement for our group, except that you're over 18 of course. Our members range from 20 to 70 y.o. We're all about making friends first and enjoying the company of others and doing wonderful activities throughout Boston. Cool couples are welcome to attend our great events as well.

Cheers!

results.description:
This group is for people who feel that their life is meant for something different than the possibilities presented to us from our parents, the media, and upbringing.

The next generation of original thinkers is often identified as ADD-spectrum, Indigos, or simply children at heart, which are all names for the same archetype of the un-programmed individual who is incapable of cultural assimilation and is thus forced to confront the shadow of the society we were born into. Eyes which are unblindable. Ears which are unpluggable.

The concepts ADD and Indigo come respectively from a scientific (3rd-person) and an empathic (2nd-person) perspective. Both of these and other perspectives are welcome, as they are not in fact contradictory.

The community, not an idea or diagnosis, is the heart of this group. We will host fun events questioning existence and the nature of a reality that combine the form of the socially-conditioned body with the experience of soul. Meet cool people who also signed up for this meetup, and tap group consciousness to empower yourself mentally, physically, and emotionally.

topics.name: Adults Taking Care of Aging Parents

results.description:
Are you a non-professional caregiver taking care of an older adult: a spouse, parent, sibling, friend or neighbor? Whether you help out full-time or just a few hours a week, caregiving is hard work and can be a strain on our emotional, psychological, financial, and physical well-being. Maybe you work at the same time, or have a family of your own to take care of, too. 

This meet-up group is for informal caregivers of older adults on the South Shore. It is a space to socialize with others who understand your challenges, share your experiences and learn from other caregivers who are in a similar position, and hopefully have a few good laughs too! 

Even if the loved one whom you cared for has recently passed, and you are still dealing with how all that feels you are welcome to join us. You were there, understand us and have something to bring to the group.

Since taking on the care of my Mother 5 years ago, I personally feel somewhat isolated. 

My established friends do not stand my unique situation and don't understand the challenges and stress caregiving brings. 

Join the group for coffee dates, lunches, brunches, dinners, seminars (when I can find them), guest speakers, or even movie nights and other events. Fun and relaxing things.  It is my hope this group will become a place of solace and support for we who could use a little care too : )

I am happy to get meetup suggestions from the group as well.

Thanks for joining us, we need you too!


PS - if you are interested, here is a link to caregiving statistics in the US.

https://www.caregiver.org/selected-caregiver-statistics
results.name: South Shore Adults Caring for Aging Loved Ones

topics.name: Personal Finance Improvement  & Get Out of Debt

results.description:
Have debt? Want to get rid of it faster? 

Join the club! This is a group for anyone who has any type of debt and is motivated to pay it off faster. High interest credit card debt? Let's get rid of it fast! Huge student loans? Let's take a look and see what can be done. Whether you have a mountain of debt, or just a little that's frustrating you, you're welcome to join us. Our meetings are fast, educational, and designed to help us all on our journey to get out of debt.


The 3 Pillars of Debt Destruction

1) Peer Support: We're a team, working together on the same side, all with the mission of paying off debt.

2) Accountability: As a good team should, we hold each other accountable for the goals we set in order to motivate each other to succeed.

3) Action: NOW is the time to act.  It's never going to get any easier, and you're not getting any younger!


Tired of the stress and anxiety of debt?  Want to stop worrying about money?  Come join us!


Message from the organizer: Hey there!  My name is Charles and in 2014 I had $25,000 in credit card debt.  At the time, I was ashamed, embarrassed, and did my best to shove it under the rug and forget about it.  I eventually realized how expensive debt can be and how the only way to make my life better was to confront it "head on."  4 months later I was debt free and had nearly doubled my income.  Today I'm still debt free and I love giving free advice and support to friends and acquaintances who are working on improving their financial situation.  We have an awesome group here of supportive, friendly "debt destroyers" and I hope you'll join us!
results.name: The Boston Debt Destroyers

results.description:
We warmly welcome you to the Boston-area Meetup for the Bruno Groening Circle of Friends! This Meetup is for people from all spiritual backgrounds, all faith and and belief systems, and all nationalities, who are interested in receiving help and healing on the spiritual path through Bruno Groening's teachings.

Bruno Groening (1906-1959), a simple German man, taught that "a divine power exists and it can heal. " He had very precise, intuitive knowledge of this healing power and  made it freely available to everyone through his teachings, helping thousands of people receive help and healing. His teachings continue to be shared today through one of the world’s largest non-profit organizations for spiritual healing, the Bruno Groening Circle of Friends.  Healings continue to this day, even of so called incurable diseases, and are recorded and verified by medical doctors and psychologists in all major specialties who work together in the Circle of Friends' Medical Scientific Group (MWF).

The Circle of Friends passes on these simple teachings free of charge through information lectures throughout the world. We invite you to attend Introductory lectures and film showings in the Boston area and experience this healing energy for yourself, in a simple and natural way. (See our Calendar for upcoming events.) There is no fee. Donations are appreciated.

Bruno Groening friends also meet locally every three weeks at Community Hours to take in the divine healing energy together. In the Boston area we currently have a Community that meets in Andover, and we are hoping to open another community closer to downtown Boston in the spring. Other New England Communities meet in South Hadley, MA, in Maine (Freeport and Ellsworth), and in Vermont (St. Johnsbury.) See our calendar for these Communities' schedules. All who wish to attend the Community Hours need to be introduced to the teachings of Bruno Groening beforehand, either at an Introductory lecture, or by phone.  Contact the Organizer for more information.

We look forward to meeting you soon, and we invite you to contact us for more information.

All warmest wishes to you on your path,

Susan Downing

Meetup Organizer and leader for New England Communities

413-531-6677

susan.downing.bg@gmail.com

Eric Guyer

Leader of the Andover Community

guyer.eric@gmail.com


More about the Bruno Groening Circle of Friends: The "Bruno Groening Circle of Friends" is a well respected international organization founded in 1979 by Grete Hausler (1922-2007) that was recently publicly awarded the "Peace Pole" by the United Nation's World Peace Prayer Society (WPPS), on May 23, 2013. This is a distinction which, in the past, has been awarded to imminent personalities such as Nobel Peace Prize Laureate MOTHER THERESA and the DALAI LAMA, as well as POPE JOHN PAUL II. www.youtube.com/watch?v=8Ehdmvmthmo

The Circle of Friends is a NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION with members in every European country and on every continent around the globe. All helpers work on a volunteer basis in their free time. The work of Bruno Groening is financed exclusively on the basis of voluntary donations. There are no financial or legal obligations. The Circle of Friends is NON-DENOMINATIONAL and is not connected to any religion. People from ALL of the major world religions belong to it.
results.name: Help & Healing on the Spiritual Path Bruno Groening Boston

results.description:
Calling all Italian speakers, Italian learners and Italy obsessed (21+). Let's enjoy five fun and relaxed evenings of conversation in Italian. Italian teacher, Carla Peretto, a native of the Veneto region, in Northern Italy, will facilitate a group conversation in a comfortable home setting with wine, cheese and dessert.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=C2-GX0Tltgw

We will meet the fourth Monday of each month, February through June 2016, 7:30pm-9pm. After an open-subject conversation, we'll focus each meeting on a specific theme, inspired by readings, art, pictures, news, recipes and other.

$25 is the fee for each of the four meetings. Wine, cheese and dessert are included .

The fee is due before the first meeting.

1. March 28th. Now we are in Sicily: a "little country" inside a country. Anyone remember Cinema Paradiso ? A movie that has received many awards. We will watch a bit of it, just a taste, and we will share our opinions on the far-gone Sicily of those days, its language, culture, etc. Nero d'Avola wine, an appetizer and cannoli will complement the night.

2. April 25th. Let's go to Toscana. Art and beautiful architecture come to our mind when we think of Firenze. Let's share the experiences and interests that tie us to this multi-faceted region, from the coastline to the countryside. We'll sip on Vino Nobile di Montepulciano and sample cantucci toscani and pecorino romano. 

2. May 23rd. Hands-on evening: pasta-making demo with a traditional tool, called torchio,  (or torcio in the local dialect) from the Veneto region for making a type of thick and rustic spaghetti called bigoli.  Of course, we will have to taste them, paired with wine and dessert. Sharing recipes will be part of the conversation.

4. June 27th. Italian writer Italo Calvino: excerpts from one of his novels, discussion about his style and his literary world. We'll share personal preferences on Italian writers, poets and genres, and talk about our plans for summer reading and traveling. Mystery wine, cheese and dessert.
results.name: Speaking of Italy

results.description: Since 1983, the non-profit Divorce Center, Inc has been providing education and resources to people before, during and after divorce. Our half-day workshop on taking the next step toward untying the knot will cover the legal, financial, family and personal issues that are often encountered during the divorce process. Trained professionals (Family Law Attorneys, Mediators, Divorce Financial Analysts and Child/Family Specialists) will provide you with knowledge and information you need to know to empower you through the divorce process with confidence and peace of mind. All our presenters are volunteers and members of The Divorce Center. We do not self-promote our own practices. We are committed to providing you with unbiased information in a compassionate and understanding way. Is Litigation the only way to go? Is Mediation or the Collaborative Process right for you? What is considered a marital asset in Massachusetts? How is child support and alimony calculated? How do we tell the children about our divorce? These questions and many others will be answered during our workshops. Each attendee receives our 32-page Resource Handbook as well The Divorce Center's Directory of Divorce Professionals. Light breakfast and beverages are included in the $30 registration fee. Pre-registration is required at www.thedivorcecenter.org. Workshops are held on the second Saturday of every other month in several Metro West locations. Other workshops say they donate their proceeds to a non-profit...we are the only non-profit in Massachusetts offering these services to the public. Your fee helps to support our mission of making divorce more civil and less traumatic, by providing you with the education and support you need to make the best choices for you and your family.
results.name: The Divorce Center - Next Step Workshop - Untying the Knot

results.description: I hope to create a place where people can meet socially and engage in spiritual conversations with people from different walks of life. This group aims to encourage engagement of inter-religious collaboration and dialogue for the sake of promoting understanding across faith systems and some tangible good in our community.  Confessedly, this is one part class assignment. I recently attended a travel seminar where we observed inter-religious conflict and harmony in India. There we saw many instances where people of various religious backgrounds linked arms for the sake of social improvement: doing things like opposing gender inequality, inter-religious conflict, and caste system injustice. Nothing in India was perfect, but for a society that has been exposed to many major religions for so long, I wonder whether there is anything we can gain and apply in our context. I think any well-rounded conversation along these lines would include people who identify with all kinds of world-views: Catholic, Humanist, Agnostic/atheistic, Spiritual but not Religious, Evangelical Christian, Mainline Christian, Unitarian Universalists, Jewish, Muslim, Buddhist, Hindu, Religious Other, Christian Other, Non-religious other, etc...

results.description:
Hi, Just so you all know. We now have 12 people which is the cap for our first meeting on March 8. If three or four more people want to form a "waiting list" that is fine with me since I'm sure something may come up for a couple of people between now (Feb. 3) and March 8.

Women 60-plus support group: Is your life changing now that you're older? Do you have more time to do exciting things? Are you surprised that you are sometimes lonely? Is it weird to be less goal-oriented?

This is a group for women who are in the midst of changing circumstance: your career has changed or gone away, your children are living their own lives, you have some health issues, yet you still have a million great ideas. One week you feel completely jazzed; the next week you wonder about the direction you're going in. Sometimes you are much too busy and sometimes you have nothing to do that feels meaningful enough.

This is a group for women who are wondering, thinking, and questioning their next goals or paths. If your one issue is quite serious (physical, emotional) then this may not be the right group for you, unless you are already seeing a health professional for that problem and you come to this group ready to share and listen to a plethora of issues.

results.description:
"We're a think-tank with a sales mindset" -- A think-tank that specializes in digesting facts/data, relating knowledge to actions, and structuring change in a prioritized, actionable way. 

In a simpler way: This group is simple: we'll meet to agree on bite-sized social initiatives, and put them into action. 

How do we find and prioritize the initiatives? We find which group of Bostonians need help the most through data. We'll leverage every piece of data we can find to build a strong group unified under one mission: provide sustainable change for the Boston groups that need it most. 

What's an example of a "group"? Purposefully undefined. Could be a racial group, like supporting blacklivesmatter, economic sustainability for the poor, finding newer solutions for homeless. 

What's success look like? Purposefully undefined. Let's define success as a group.

results.description:
Hello fellow lovers of Democracy! 

Got the democracy blues? We know that it's easy to despair over some of the critical yet commonplace issues in our society- climate change, racial inequality, a staggering income gap, Washington infighting. We chose, instead, to take action to address the root of these issues- Democracy! We at Small Planet Institute are focused on what we call "living democracy," which is both a daily personal practice and a requirement of a government that answers to its people. To attain the kind of democracy we want to see, we're tackling, with a strong network of others, the all-powerful hand of big money in politics. 

In this light, we're happy to announce our Democracy Den community gatherings, held in our Harvard Square office. We're thinking movie screenings, book discussions, trainings, social gatherings. We're creating a "there" for community to come together in the most fundamental practice of democracy. Let's ACT! If we can bridge cultural gaps, learn and share, and be inspired by stories of success or struggle, we are practicing the "living democracy" that we need to see on our municipal, state and federal levels, too. 

We're currently working on a money-out-of politics field guide, researching and writing a book, hosting events, and organizing for this April's mass action, Democracy Spring. Come to our meetups if you're ready to act.
results.name: Democracy Dinner at Small Planet Institute in Cambridge

results.description:
Boston Indies is a community of dedicated independent game developers in Massachusetts and the surrounding area. We define ourselves in connection with our community spirit and our group objectives. We gather in person once a month to talk about the art and craft of making video games, and to share our work with each other. 

Our goals are to: 

• Foster a sense of community among Boston’s independent game developers 

• Facilitate the monthly meetup and other related community events 

• Encourage developers to create games independent of large budgets and large company ties. 

• Provide a safe environment to obtain critical feedback on game development works in progress. 

• Serve as a brain trust for important information sharing among local independent developers 

We are completely agnostic with respect to technology, development platform, game type, and scope of game development. As long as you show up with an open mind and a helpful attitude and you are committed to making your own games, on your own terms, you are welcome to join us.

The Core Mission of this group is to facilitate a connection between the two core personas needed to create a successful technology startup: the Hacker and the Hustler. Bring your ideas, find inspiration for an idea, help others refine their ideas, and find your future co-founder. 

Hackers: If you are a software engineer, coder, hardware expert, designer, architect,  and/or general tech geek and are looking to meet someone to partner with to formulate a business plan and handle the business side of things, this meetup is for you. 


Hustlers: If you are a business oriented thinker - marketing, sales, finance, deal maker etc. and are looking to meet someone to partner with to handle the technology side of things, this meetup is for you. 

Who this meetup is not for: Close-minded thinkers. 

Who this meetup is for: Technology and Business entrepreneurs looking to discuss ideas, network, and meet their future co-founder. 

Meeting Format: Each meeting we will begin with a 30 minute networking session, followed by three business or technology concept discussions. The concept discussion can be a business plan, technology / design concept, or problem / opportunity that you believe could be a potential business. Really anything that you would like to discuss in a structured format with the group at large. You will have 5 minutes to explain your topic, and the group will engage in a brainstorm for 15 minutes. If you would like to submit a concept to be one of the three that are discussed, please email me prior to the meeting at Ghvallone@gmail.com.
results.name: Hackers and Hustlers

results.description:
Do gods exist? What about the god of the Christian Bible, etc? What about the historical assertions? Is the theological code valid? What about New Age beliefs, Reiki, homeopathy, etc? Without simply proselytizing, this group is meant to be an open atmosphere for believers and nonbelievers of all backgrounds (I refer a lot to Christianity because it is most familiar to me) to vent their beliefs as well as their doubts. I only ask that you enter with a critical thinking mindset - this is not church; this is a group for those willing to openly and honestly consider the veracity of their beliefs against a devil's advocate, not for the preachers or the choir looking for a flock. We are not lost sheep. We care about what is actually true, how strongly we should believe or not believe, and what those beliefs do and do not accomplish in the world.


Base rules:

1. Be cool. Ad hominem attacks are not cool. If someone makes a point about your belief, saying they're just going to Hell anyway neither refutes their point nor adds to productive, friendly conversation.

2. Be open. Your positions will be put to the test against a devil's advocate. That should be okay with you.

3. Be respectful. It's like being cool. Everyone has a right to believe what they want, when you get right down to it.

4. Be honest. If someone makes a good point, don't dodge it.

5. Participate, if you're comfortable. There is no requirement to speak.
results.name: Marlborough Belief Discussion & Debate

results.description: Let's get together to learn about all aspects of natural living for wellness. We will discuss healthy recipes, essential oils, skin care remedies, herbs, container gardening, and TONS of DIY fun! Maybe you have heard the term essential oils but didn’t know what it meant. Perhaps you had a vague idea that it was connected in some way with aromatherapy, but didn’t know how. Now is as good a time as any to learn what essential oils are. When essential oils are inhaled (aromatherapy), they reach the limbic system of the brain and go on to affect all the systems that it interfaces with. These include the circulatory system, the respiratory system, the endocrine system, and memory. In the bloodstream, they affect the organs as well. I enjoy incorporating essential oils in my daily life - in my skin care, health remedies, cleaning AND cooking!

results.description:
Want detailed, practical suggestions to help your clients (individuals or couples) have better relationships? You've found the right place!

Our warm, friendly consultation groups welcome psychotherapists who want to improve their effectiveness in relationship counseling. Come regularly, or drop in when you choose. Your first visit is free!

Any relationship topic is fair game: connection, communication, conflict, sexuality (including kink/BDSM and polyamory), abuse, affairs, and more. Bring your questions and leave with tips, techniques, handouts, and other resources.

All therapeutic approaches are welcome. The group leader integrates Solution-Focused Therapy, Motivational Interviewing, CBT (including DBT), John Gottman’s research on couples, Feedback-Informed Treatment, and social constructionism.

Your clients can enjoy more satisfying relationships. Join us and learn how.
results.name: Boston Couples Therapy Training

results.description:
Is your tween really, REALLY into Minecraft, LittleBigPlanet or Pokemon??? Are you a parent who'd like to see him/her interact with others while having some fun yourself? Look no further! A new meet-up group is starting in Brighton for parents like us with kids (age 9-14yrs) like them. 

The Idea Is Simple... Families sign up to host other families in their homes on weekends to play games. While the children play the above mentioned video games together, the adults have fun as well playing family friendly group games of their own. Games played can be agreed upon ahead of time or decided on the fly. The Rules Are Simple: Children's Video Games: An adult must be present to supervise their child(ren) at all times Each child must bring their own controller w/ charger (this is in case it breaks) Other video games can be played, so long as they are rated "Teen" or BELOW and all attending parents agree Adult Games: all games played must be family friendly (using no vulgar language or inappropriate gestures) 

NOTE: Remember you are in someone else's home. Please be courteous, mindful of your language & respect house rules. Above all, HAVE FUN!!! An Important Note To Food and Drinks! To ensure the safety and well being of all who attend, it is important that families having anyone with a food or drink allergy notify the other before getting together. Please bring your own snacks & drinks in a suitable container, especially for children. Families wishing to host over a meal time should state their intention to do so. Options incl: ordering out, eating in w/ families all bringing a dish, or eating in with families paying a per person $ amount to the host family to cook one meal for all.
results.name: Minecraft, LBP & Pokemon Tween/Parent Weekend Gaming Group

results.description: We'll be tasting and discussing fine olive oils and sharing our experiences of awakening and delight. We'll get to know some of the hundreds of varieties -- some common, some not -- and the different tendencies and flavor profiles contained within each.  Olive oils can be grassy, fruity, pungent, bitter and spicy. We'll learn where the various varieties are grown and perhaps some of their history. We'll explore how to properly assess and use an olive oil, and how best to match a particular dish with the right oil. Generally, we'll have a lot of fun with this ancient food that is such a vital part of the Mediterranean diet, explore why it's under-appreciated in the US, and finally put it into the context of human history, culture and cuisine.

ONE crew is made up of a diverse group of paddlers from all experience levels. We know how to work hard on the water and play hard off the water. Whether you are big, small, young, old, single, or have a family, we want you! Never paddle before? Our friendly coaches can show you how. If you are looking for a great way to stay fit, have some fun in the sun, meet new people, or find out what a dragon boat is, come join us! If you are looking to be among a great group of people who know how to come together as ONE team to get pass the word "can't" and accomplish what you thought were impossible, come join us! 

We meet 4 times a week in the summer and twice a week in the winter. ONE offers 3 free trials and provides all necessary equipment for paddling. Looking for a great way to stay in shape during the winter and get rid of those winter blues? Join us for a workout! Sessions and updates will be posted on event page comments. 

Though our paddling passion is infectious, attendance is voluntary. Come prepare to get your sweat on. Bring water, a towel, and a smile. We look forward to meeting you and introducing you to our Ohana! 

"Ohana means family. Family means no one gets left behind or forgotten" - Lilo and Stitch

No auditions are required, and all voice types are welcome. A focus on classical music, American patriotic songs, spirituals, and lieder.

https://www.facebook.com/SchillerInstituteBostonCommunityChorus

http://schillerinstitute.org/highlite/2015/1219-nyc-messiah/main.html


All of our rehearsals and performances are held at the Verdi Scientific tuning of A=432 Hz. The Schiller Institute was founded over 30 years ago by Helga Zepp-LaRouche, wife of statesman Lyndon LaRouche, with a mission to draw from the most beautiful ideas mankind has to offer, in order to uplift mankind. Mrs. LaRouche, known affectionately in China as the "Silk Road Lady," has been instrumental in the development of what was announced in 2014 as China's policy of Silk Road Development, One Belt One Road.

results.description:
The Inner Engineering Meetup group offers free meditation classes, yoga programs, public events, and social gatherings where we can come together to practice, learn more, relax and have fun! 

We look forward to meeting you, soon! 

--------------

"If life were to come with a manual, this in my opinion would be it! If we all applied the Inner Engineering technology, our world would instantly transform to exist from a foundation of peace, joy, and compassion for all beings."  -Evita Ochel    

For all of the strides we have made in science and technology with standards of living unimaginable a century ago, most human beings still remain in search of wholeness and purpose in their lives.  Inner Engineering is scientifically-structured to offer powerful processes from the ancient tradition of yoga to transcend the limitations of who you are and bring you to higher levels of consciousness.  Inner Engineering was designed by Sadhguru, a yogi, visionary, and one the foremost authorities on yoga as a powerful tool to create your life the way you want it.   

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hUeyqLTsGJs

Sadhguru & Deepak Chopra— Creating Inner Peace, Joy and Fulfillment in a Hectic Modern World 

"The word 'yoga' means union, that means you experience the entire universe as yourself...by working with the body, by working with the mind, by working with your emotion and energy, you can setup a step-by- step system within yourself where your energies are kept at such a level of exuberance that your sensory body is as large as the universe...Once you experience everybody around you as yourself... your goodness is a consequence, not an effort."

https://youtu.be/WMhJgdpj1d0

About Sadhguru—Sadhguru is a realized yogi and mystic – a man whose passion spills into everything he encounters. With a keen mind, balanced by a heart that knows no boundary, his presence and powerful yoga programs create an extraordinary opportunity to break through limitations into one’s natural state of freedom, love and joy. 

Sadhguru has a unique ability to make the ancient science of yoga relevant to contemporary minds. Sadhguru serves as a bridge to the deeper dimensions of life. His approach does not ascribe to any belief system, but offers methods for self-transformation that are both proven and powerful.

An author, poet and internationally renowned speaker, Sadhguru’s wit and piercing logic provoke and broaden our thoughts and perception of the meaning of life, the very purpose of life. Sadhguru has been an influential voice at major global forums including the UN, MIT, TED, and the World Economic Forum.

Sadhguru established Isha Foundation, a non-profit organization supported by over two million volunteers worldwide. From powerful yoga programs and meditation practices to large-scale humanitarian projects, the foundation’s activities are designed to create an inclusive culture and establish global harmony, earning a special consultative status with the United Nations.

Sadhguru at Emory University—  "Consciousness and living well are not in conflict with each other...  "

https://youtu.be/FVdDwS0ijU4

------------------ 

Isha Kriya Guided Meditation—Jump Right In... Learn to Meditate NOW! 

These 1-hour guided meditation sessions offer a simple, but powerful kriya practice that aligns your mind, body, and inner-energies to elevate your conscious awareness and easily and naturally achieve a state of deep meditation. Once you are meditative on a daily basis, your experience of the life within you and the world around you becomes much richer. Daily meditation makes your life stress-free, effortless and joyful! 

You can easily learn this 12-to-18 minute Isha Kriya process in a convenient, online meditation class, or through a live, free meditation class near you.  Our online formats include our streaming guided meditation video, the Isha Kriya meditation app (for iphone & android devices), and weekly webinars hosted by trained teachers who can answer your questions about the practice.  Local sessions are hosted regularly to enhance and deepen the experience of meditation with the group. 

Benefits of regular Isha Kriya meditation practice include improving health, energy and vitality; enhancing mental focus, memory and clarity; reducing stress and establishing a deep sense of peace and inner balance. 

Isha Kriya is a simple, gentle guided meditation that can be done seated cross-legged on the floor or sitting in a chair. No previous meditation experience is necessary.

https://youtu.be/q8NYZdYd5GQ

Take a  Deeper Step...Create a Life of Total Wellbeing—

“Inner Engineering is neither a religion, nor a philosophy or dogma. It is a technology for wellbeing. One does not have to believe or disbelieve--just have to learn to use...  Technology will produce results irrespective of who you are.” –Sadhguru  

Inner Engineering is a 7-session online course that gives you the opportunity to intellectually explore the ABC’s of life using methods that are the distilled essence of yogic sciences. The course imparts practical wisdom to manage your body, mind, emotions, and the fundamental life energy within. 

Program components include:

• Enlightening interactive sessions

• Guided meditations

• Asanas, simple yoga postures.

• Shambhavi Mahamudra, a powerful , 21-minute inner-energy technique that brings your entire system into alignment so that your body, mind, emotions and energies function in harmony.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_embedded&v=ooFAmT4n89Y

**Live Reviews from Inner Engineering Participants ** 

------------------

The Isha Institute of Inner-sciences is a breathtaking mountain retreat for stress relief, rejuvenation, and complete inner well-being. The retreat offers yoga in its purest form, through experiential classical yoga and meditation classes, and powerfully energized meditation spaces such as the Adi Yogi: The Abode of Yoga.  

https://youtu.be/RpXEcB5uhZc

A Serene Mountain Getaway to Learn Classical Yoga: 
Relax and rejuvenate at the Isha yoga retreat—

The Isha Institute of Inner-sciences is a world-class yoga center offering classical yoga and meditation classes from beginner to advanced levels. Guests journey from around the globe to visit this unique destination to relax, reflect, and reconnect with nature in this tranquil oasis nestled in Tennessee’s spectacular Upper Cumberland.

Drop-by for a Day Visit

The Isha retreat center offers campus tours daily that include light hikes to one of many beautiful bluff vistas or waterfalls and a visit inside Mahima, the largest yoga and meditation hall in the western hemisphere! Several free yoga classes and guided meditation sessions are available each day.  Inquire with the main office for details.

Hiking and Mountain Biking on Pristine Forested Trails

The Isha retreat center also offers myriad opportunities for hiking and mountain biking on forested trails winding throughout nearly 1400 acres. The center's five miles of mountain biking trails have been professionally classified from beginner to intermediate skill levels, with steep climbs, water features, and tight switchbacks on the more challenging portions. The trails are part of an expanding network of over 15 miles of hiking and biking trails featuring beautiful waterfalls, a meandering spring-fed creek, and breathtaking bluff overlooks.

Relaxation & Wellness Retreats

Overnight stays include the option of private studio accommodations, delicious vegetarian buffet meals, and beginner-level yoga classes of the visitor`s choice, such as the 'yoga of sound', yoga for strengthening the joints, and yoga for purifying life energies.  Extended retreat packages feature Ayurvedic rejuvenation consultations and therapies; guided hikes and adventure outings to nearby caves, rivers and falls; and even cooking classes to bring home some of your favorite vegetarian delights!  Learn how to mix the pungent, tangy spices of the East, culture farm-fresh milk into yogurt, roll vegetarian sushi, or bake homemade sourdough bread in the Isha center's popular, international kitchen.

For over 30 years, Isha Institute programs have offered the immense benefits of classical yoga and meditation to over 7 million people around the globe. For further details on the Isha retreat center and the programs offered, visit IshaUSA.org.

Visit us online...

IshaUSA Blog: http://www.ishafoundation.org/us/blog/ 
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/InnerEngineering  ; https://www.facebook.com/IshaUSA/ 
Twitter:  https://twitter.com/IshaUSA 
Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/user/IshaInnerEngineering

results.description:
Do you want a kick-ass army of allies that have your back, encourage you to live big, and are there to help you create, mastermind and bring into the world what you know is possible...and have fun in the process?

The Ollin Alliance (pronounced “ALL-in”) is a community of passionate explorers and leaders of all types that want to learn and practice the advanced skills of personal, collaborative and collective mastery in order to create a truly emergent leading-edge community.

Wanting to collaborate and contribute to the common good is awesome! However it’s not enough. We need a fundamental shift in the way we collaborate and create together*.

That shift requires, individually and collectively...expanded skills, frameworks and perspectives. It requires a forum to learn, practice and experiment.  We hope to offer that and more through The Ollin Alliance.

Do you want to...

- Learn & Practice Evolving Edge Skills
- Go Beyond Traditional Networking
- Get Your Work Out in the World & Have a Positive Impact
- Collaborate & Create Collective Ventures that Benefit the World

Types of Events:
We will be offering a variety of event types and price points.

- How to Get the Most out of The Alliance Orientation Evenings
- Themed Support & Facilitated Networking
- Personal Process & Mastery Forums
- Professional Training Classes & Workshops
- Facilitation & Leadership Training
- Marketing & Promotions Support
- Collaborative Conferences

*We use the analogy of shifting from an “Orchestra” model to a “Jazz Improv” collaboration….where each person has their unique instrument (Expression) which they are an expert in. Each player comes together with the intention of playing amazing music (Purpose), but rather than a fixed song, the joy comes from what emerges (Growth) as they lean into each other supporting “what the music wants” and each other in their solos (Connection.)

What is created is beyond any song we could have imagined.

This group is the local leadership community of The Ollin Institute. Membership is currently free.

Check out our Manifesto.

For more information see the Ollin Institute website. www.ollininstitute.com

results.description:
Does GE Predix have the potential to become the engine behind most successful industrial products of the next 10-20 years? Absolutely! 

A much better question is how, and in what new ways, can we: 

a) do better things with the massive amounts of data coming out of all sorts of machines 

b) build industrial IoT applications and predictive APIs at 10x the speed at 1/10 the cost 

Why? 

Because with Predix we can. 

Founders of this group believe that Predix will help conceive, deliver and scale some of the most important industrial advances of the next 10-20 years. 

So.... why don't we standardize and democratize the field with and around Predix, and help change the world!? 

What. 

We are a local micro community of those interested in advancing their knowledge of Predix, its use cases and applications. 

How. 

Join our group for a regular dose of human interaction, conversations, smiles, food and drinks on all things Predix: 

∙ How-To’s 

∙ Review of Predix Services 

∙ Do’s and Don’ts 

∙ Best Practices in User Experience 

∙ Application Templates

∙ Building predictive APIs 

∙ Security on the edge, in the cloud, and in transit 

We will learn how others solve some of the hard problems that exist in the world of machines around us, and how others make predictive APIs and applications using Predix. 

Join the movement. Let’s change the world. Because with Predix we can.
results.name: GE Predix Boston (Industrial Internet)

results.description: We like to play collaborative, improvisational music with new people, especially those who have never played before. We also like to meet up with people who just want to eat, drink, dance, or socialize with music in the background. The exact nature of the jam will depend on who is participating and where it is held, but the goal is to play with minimal discussion and no preparation. Don't expect any level of skill or familiarity, so no covers. This style of play does result in some rough patches. We develop a strange appreciation of these rough spots; however, the goal is to find grooves. We don't mind riding through some mess, but we also try to hold onto those groovy riffs. We shoot for something between the chaotic, dissonant nature of free improvisation and the tedium of practiced music. At the end of the day, it is just supposed to be fun. Nobody should ever tell anyone else they are messing up. But at the same time, everyone should be trying to play in such a way that it is easy for others to work with. This might mean playing simple repetitive patterns with a limited set of tones (or keeping a steady beat on the drums). No theory is necessary, but if you are curious, look into the Circle of Fifths, pentatonic scales, and keys. We like to switch around on the instruments. It is helpful if everyone is willing to play drums for a bit (drumming the whole time can be tiresome). Anyway, hopefully that long description didn't scare you away. We look forward to meeting you!
results.name: Alewife Jams - a playful group for improvisational music

results.description:
I started this group because I'm interested in the weird, magical, ancient, and unexplainable places and events that we often encounter, even in this science-focused, rationally oriented culture.


I haven't yet decided on a format for group events, so I welcome suggestions. What I do know is that I'd like to create a community that can do things like explore abandoned places, learn about how energy travels through the body, and talk about voodoo. I’m still discovering topics such as these myself, so people of all knowledge levels are welcome—definitely including those more aware than me! We’ll figure this all out together.


As for the name of the group, it's an anagram of my last name. Letters have special power, as people from George Eastman, the founder of Kodak, to believers in Kabbalah, an esoteric school of thought, have recognized. I too love language--and the word grail seemed fitting for the topics of group as well. Dictionary.com defines grail as: 1. a cup or chalice that in medieval legend was associated with unusual powers, especially the regeneration of life and, later, Christian purity, and was much sought after by medieval knights: identified with the cup used at the Last Supper and given to Joseph of Arimathea. 2. any greatly desired and sought-after objective; ultimate ideal or reward. I hope that together we can find our own grails in this complex and multifaceted world.
results.name: Grail I

results.description:
This is a group for Asian/Asian-American men looking to network with peers and make new friends beyond a professional setting. It's a group where we can have honest dialogues with each other about various topics that are relevant for the Asian-American male today: 

- Making Money/developing your career/learning how to be a boss 

- Health and Fitness 

- Relationships/women

- Asian-related politics/news 

- Empowerment/mentorship 

- Reconciling Asian culture in America (aka dealing with your Asian parents) 

...And anything else worth talking about that other Asian guys will uniquely understand. 

I started this group because the notion of Asian brotherhood has never really existed, especially across Pan-Asian lines. Whether you are Chinese, Vietnamese, Indian or any other type of Asian, I'd love to have you join. The Asian-American narrative is starting to shift in the US, and solidarity is more important than ever. Whether you are an American-born Asian, or a recent immigrant, young or old...It doesn't matter. We can all learn from each other and help each other out. 

I think it's pathetic that Asians make more money than any other group in this country, yet have almost no voice in politics, Hollywood and general pop culture. Let's change that.

Once this group reaches a respectable number, I'll initiate a meetup in the Greater Boston area, typically in Boston Proper, Cambridge, or Somerville. There will be happy hours, cigars, dinners, and much more to come. I hope you'll give it a shot!

The idea behind this meetup is to form a small sized group of people that are interested in learning and training Krav Maga based/inspired defense and combatives basics. This group has no instructor or school affiliation, and is not taught or led by an instructor or Krav expert. Instead, we hope to find like-minded men and women with minimal-to-moderate experience with martial arts, or contact sports, that are interested in training together in practical self-defense. If you are highly-trained or ranked, this informal group may be too slow/rudimentary for you. Important to note, we plan to learn and train at half/full-speed and physical contact will be incorporated into drills. We plan to use specific source material (to be discussed at first meetup) to create loose training plans around established and well-defined basics, skills, and drills.

Please consider joining if this description interests you and you're serious about building some basic skills, based on real-world scenarios, with like-minded people. We'll take the training seriously, but ourselves not so much - let's train hard and have fun.

results.description: This meetup has been formed to discuss customer use cases and design patterns related to Apache Apex, a next generation native Hadoop big data platform. Apex platform is designed to enable application level java engineers to develop big data apps, devops to easily integrate and support the app, and to ensure that time to market is met by timely launch. Apex is designed to reduce the cost of support and operations. Apex unifies stream and batch processing. Use cases include ingestion, fast real-time analytics, data movement, disastor recovery in Hadoop, ETL, fast batch, alerts and real-time actions. Apex is a Hadoop-native YARN implementation. It simplifies development and productization of Hadoop applications by reducing time to market. Key features include Enterprise Grade Operability with Fault Tolerance, State Management, Event Processing Guarantees, No Data Loss, High Performance, Linear Scalability. Additionally Apache Apex includes Apache Malhar library of over 400 reusable operators (functions). These include connectors to external systems like message bus, file systems, databases, etc. Apache Apex enables users to run any user defined code natively in Hadoop. You are welcome to take on a deeper engagement with Apache Software Foundation community.
results.name: Apache Apex (native Hadoop) Boston Chapter

results.description: In celebration of Women's History Month, the LOCS Collective, Inc. in collaboration with Harvard Law School's LAMBDA organization, presents New England’s Annual Lesbians of Color Symposium (LOCS). Since 2012, LOCS unites LBTQ women of color and allies for a day of networking, advocacy and empowerment. LOCS features 60-75 minute workshops/sessions focusing on various topics impacting our community. The 4th Annual LOCS will be held on Saturday, March 19, 2016. LOCS Collective’s purpose is to address the gross disparities that exist regarding access to community and resources for LBTQ women of color in Boston and surrounding areas. Concurrently, there are few organizations dedicated to providing services solely to LBTQ women of color. Our vision is to create spaces/platforms for LBTQ identified women of color in Boston and surrounding areas to celebrate our vibrant culture, solidify our community and increase our visibility. We do this by: Developing partnerships with regional and national organizations that serve and support LBTQ identified women of color and streamlining their resources into our communities. Encouraging supportive and respectful discussions within and outside our community. Empowering through activism, education and networking. ALLY PRIDE: In addition to uplifting LBTQ communities of color we also recognize the undeniable necessity to foster genuine and wholesome relationships with our allies, charging ourselves as well as other communities to actively advocate for one another. We encourage community collaboration and development. Allies are ALWAYS welcome.
results.name: Lesbians of Color Symposium

results.description:
The circular economy Meetup is for companies and decision makers within them charged making their organizations more sustainable and more specifically tasked to reduce material and energy leakage in their biological or technical supply chains through the implementation of the Circular Economic model. http://www.ellenmacarthurfoundation.org

Ideal members of the group would include Chief Sustainability Officers, Continuous Improvement Teams, Supply Chain Managers, Six Sigma practitioners, etc. Additionally any organization involved in developing new technologies or processes to help organizations improve their process flows, recover materials, or regenerate them would be equally well suited to the Meetup. Public sector and government agencies tasked with Green Economy initiatives and promoting circular economic like programs would also be welcome contributors to the group.

Members of the Meetup can expect to learn about the adoption of the circular economic model and ways their organizations can implement the model. Members could expect to connect and network with other similarly challenged decision makers from other organizations. There will also be real opportunities for organizations to find the necessary partners and/or third party providers to implement their circular economic model initiatives. 

The goal of the circular economy Meetup is to create a community of connected colleagues who can help each other better understand the circular economic model and make more informed decisions based on that knowledge for their organizations. Typical activities will include sharing information about where and how the U.S. the circular economy is being adopted. Actual case studies of circular economy implementations will be presented for discussion. Panel discussions and Q&A sessions that bring together the public and private sectors to discuss ways to work together will also be a regular part of the agenda. Members will be encouraged to share their experiences and to make introductions among each other to facilitate the successful use of the circular economic model. Lastly, the meet up will look for ways to promote the circular economic model to the wider public will be explored.

As the circular economic model is well regarded and increasingly woven into sustainability programs and policies in Europe, the model is still in its infancy here in the U.S. As Boston and the state of Massachusetts is known for promoting innovation across a wide number of industries, it makes  Cambridge venue an ideal location for educating organizations about the circular economy and its benefits.
results.name: Massachusetts Circular Economy - Cambridge, MA

results.description:
The following sums up what this Meetup is all about.

NO DRAMA.....Just positive happy people looking to unite with others:)

Love fully. Laugh daily. Be silly. Embrace your dreams! Feel gratitude for the simplest of pleasures. Discover the beauty of silence. Spend quiet time alone each day.

Live from your heart not your head. Keep a gratitude journal. Be an inspiration to others. Shine your light for others to follow. Be more – do less. Release fear. Allow yourself to receive the blessings of life.

Living a joyful life is a choice – choose wisely. Release the shackles of self-judgment. Step outside your comfort zone. Take baby steps each day toward the life of your dreams. Believe in the truth that anything is truly possible – because it IS! Discover the wisdom within!

Be prepared for life’s curveballs and remember to duck. Remember that you are not your past or your mistakes. Release the mistakes of the past and carry forward only the lessons they contain. You have the power to rewrite your story at any time. Surround yourself with those who honor the best in you.

You are a unique gift to the world and you are meant to shine. Follow your passion and you will never dread going to ‘work’ each day.

To make a new friend – be a friend. In every relationship, both personal and professional ask yourself “How can I serve?” Reach out and support the dreams of others. Join a Mastermind or two and connect with those who encourage your dreams. Imagine the possibilities then create them.

 Live your life – not the life others imagined for you. Be a spiritual warrior! Embrace your Higher Power. Connect daily to your source. Live a juicy, joyful, passionate life. Your passions are your guide to your divine purpose – follow them. Write your ‘bucket list’ and cross things off each week. View every interaction as a path to growth. Find your ‘tribe’. Look at every life experience as a tool to reconnecting with your authentic self. Visualize the life you desire. Create a sacred space in your home.

Give back. Pick a cause and support it wholeheartedly. Discover your unique passion and mission and bring it forward to make a difference in the world.

Surround yourself with those who lift you up. Release those people or things that prevent you from shining your light. Believe in the power of forgiveness. Open your heart to see the divine beauty in everyone.

Read publications that inspire you to live from the inside out. Tune in to the wisdom and insights of those who have walked the path before you. Ignite your passion!

Honor your body and feed your soul. Nourish your relationships. Maintain balance. Be your own best friend. Embrace change. And most importantly – love yourself! You are perfect just as you are!

Compliments: Inspire me;

results.description:
In working with high performing women across the globe I have noticed women tend to manage (or take on) more, work longer hours, have a harder time transitioning from work to personal all while getting paid less than their male counter parts. We are hearing more and more about this through recent research, the political climate and direct observations and experiences. That is what has inspired the formation of this group. 

This group will create a space to explore, debate, and enhance the dialogue on what is critical to a professional woman’s success. This group's purpose is to create an active and supportive community that learns from the community at large and each other on how to succeed in the professional world. 

Goals 

* To provide a place where women talk about women issues and opportunities in the work place 

* Explore, share and learn effective ways to navigate organizations and colleagues 

* Explore how and if mentoring works / is working 

* Identify, understand and support each others success 

* Learn from each other 

* Support groups that are aligned with and/or support professional women

B.B.N’s seminars address just about every business topic imaginable including traditional, online and mobile marketing, personal development, social media, sales, networking, raising capital, crowd sourcing, gamification, branding, search engine optimization, web design and much much more. results.description:
As someone who is interested in politics, but moderate and pragmatic in outlook, I've noticed the national political discourse becoming more extreme, partisan and ideological. This isn't to impugn anyone who fits these categories. I feel like these attitudes have a part to play in political discourse. However, I've been finding it harder to find nuanced discussion in both the media, and, sometimes, even, in everyday life. 

This Meetup is an attempt to rectify that, find people who are similarly interested, and get together and talk. While I don't imagine this group to be directly activist, if people want to use it to meet others with similar outlooks who are interested in organizing, I think that would be great. 

I'll admit, I don't have an exact definition of a moderate. Thus, if the title rings true to you, please take the leap and come on down. This group is intended to be non-partisan - Democrats, Republicans, Libertarians, Green Party members, are all welcome. In my opinion, and my experience, most people are moderates not because they lack passion for their beliefs, or because of any particular ideology, but because they understand many different points of view and respect the nuance and difficulty of dealing with complex issues. 

As you may have guessed, this is a bit of an experiment, so the shape of the group will most likely change over time. To start, I imagine we'll have a topic and perhaps some reading beforehand so that people can have a general reference point for the discussion (I'm thinking articles, not whole books). But, if people are interested, join, send me a message, and let me know what interests you so that we can figure out a way to make this work.
results.name: Moderate Politics Meetup

results.description:
Orienteering...More than navigating or roaming the outdoors! Orienteering is a compass and map navigation sport done for exercise and fun. Participants are challenged to find a series of unique three-sided flags hidden on various courses in a park or a forest using only a map, compass, and their wits. The sport is enjoyed by walkers, hikers, runners, and families with kids. All events are timed, but it is up to each participant to decide whether to casually walk a course, or run it like it was their own personal amazing race. Very easy, beginner, and intermediate orienteering courses, along with training on how to use a compass and read a topography map, occur at all New England Orienteering (NEOC) events. 

The New England Orienteering Club is an all volunteer non-profit dedicated to promoting the sport of orienteering. More information on the orienteering schedule is available at www.newenglandorienteering.org. NEOC was founded in 1972 to promote the sport of orienteering and develop suitable maps. Today, NEOC has over 400 members, organizes approximately 40 events per year, and has produced nearly 40 specialized, five color orienteering maps in Massachusetts, Rhode Island and eastern Connecticut.
results.name: New England Orienteering Club

results.description:
Calling all people interested in great food, good company and casual dinners! I started this group to introduce more people to delicious vegan food and how to cook. We'll get together from time to time at my home in Milton to cook a delicious meal together and then eat it. Hopefully, with lots of casual conversation and plenty of opportunities to learn how to make your own delicious food without being intimidated by ingredients you've never heard of. I'll pull together a menu (suggestions welcome) and a cost per person, then buy the ingredients and the group with come over to make and eat great meal together. Everything will be vegan in a very non-threatening, no superiority or hostility environment where you take a break from being a carnivore. Or, if you're already vegetarian or vegan, learn how to cook those dishes that seem a little intimidating. Emphasis is on: good food, learning how to cook, and an enjoyable meal with people open to new things!

Please note: this is not a "healthy food" club. There are lots of people who see vegan food only as a holistic natural lifestyle that is filled with beautiful vegetables and great health. This club isn't for those people.  Rather, this club is for people who enjoy eating great food and learning how to make it.  Not nibling on celery sticks with almond butter (although that is a really tasty snack!). So, there is no way that any of the food we'll be making and eating can be classified as "health food".   If you're looking for a way to shed calories from your diet, this is not the group for you. I am not a health food person, not even remotely. But I'm 100% plant fueled.   I'm asking people to pay for being in this club and attending suppers, so I don't want there to be any confusion about the type of vegan food this club will be working with. Of course, the health benefits of a plant-based diet are numerous and significant.   Additionally, this is not a group to figure out how to be vegan on a budget. This is a group about eating great food and learning how to cook it with some really nice people. 

A note about "dues" -- Meetup isn't free.  In order to create a group, it costs ~$15 a month.  Therefore, the dues are to recoup my costs in setting up the group.  You only need to pay dues if you want to actually attend an actual Vegan Supper Club Meetup.  You can be a member and just wait for a meetup that you'd like to attend: then pay your $5 dues at that time.  It doesn't cost anything to be a member of the group, but it will cost $5 a year if you want to attend an actual supper.  Hope that makes sense!

Costs: there will be a charge to attend an actual supper.  The charge will vary by event, and will be clearly described.  I anticipate that it will cost $30-$45 per person for each supper: you get a great 3 course meal, learn about vegan food and how to cook it, great conversation and drinks in a fun environment.
results.name: Boston Vegan Supper Club

results.description:
The Boston area has the most diverse information security ecosystem in the world.  Over the past several years our local community has been increasingly underserved and misaligned, so we are trying to do our part by launching a new monthly meetup (and more).  We understand that the current community has several various meetups/events and expect some skepticism, so let us tell you what we are about:

• We are putting this together for practitioners to have a safe place to come meet likeminded people, share cool ideas, and discuss real issues.

•  Our events are not a place for marketers, sales people, or recruiters.  We will politely ask anyone that fits that criteria to leave (this includes sponsors), unless we have an event specifically designed to engage those relevant parties (e.g., a recruiting event).

• Content will be driven by the community.  We also remember that a big part of these events is to bring the community together, so lightining talks are preferred.  This will not be a place that you come after work to watch people lecture at you for three hours.

• RSVP's are highly encouraged for our events, but unless specified otherwise all practitioners, or those interested in learning about security, are encouraged to come eat, drink, meet others in the community, and share ideas... no strings attached.
results.name: New Boston Security Meetup

results.description:
Does The Hyperledger Project have the potential to become the engine behind most successful decentralized applications and organizations created in the next 25-50 years? Absolutely!

A much better question is how, and in what new ways, can we:

a) Build decentralized applications, organizations and APIs at 10x the speed at 1/10 the cost.

b) Build situational awareness in the local community.

I believe that the convergence of decentralized applications, decentralized organizations, artificial intelligence and IoT brings upon us the Great Displacement of the 21st century, where the majority of workforce will be left without “conventional” jobs, forced to learn new skills and professions.

Why?

Founders of this group believe that the Hyperledger Foundation will be the engine behind decentralization of the world, a massive economic change of the next 25-50 years.

So.... why don't we standardize and democratize the field with and around Hyperledger?

What?

We are a local micro community of those interested in advancing their knowledge of Hyperledger, its use cases and applications.

How?

Join our group for a regular dose of human interaction, conversations, smiles, food and drinks on all things Hyperledger:

• Use Cases

• Competitive analysis of Hyperledger startups (Distributed Apps from disruptive companies in specific vertical markets)

• How-To’s

• Interviews with individuals working at the edge of the Hyperledger project

• Reviews of tools, services and APIs offered by the Hyperledger ecosystem

• Best Practices in Application Architecture

• Do’s and Don’ts

• Application Templates

• Hackathons

• Security in the decentralized world - on the edge, on the node, in the cloud and in transit

• How others solve some of the hard problems that exist in the world using Hyperledger.

https://www.hyperledger.org

https://github.com/hyperledger

Join the movement. Let’s change the world. Because with Hyperledger we can.
results.name: Hyperledger (Boston Chapter)

results.description:
Welcome! Big Data Ingesters,

This meetup has been formed to discuss customer use cases and design patterns for big data ingestion, transformation, and egression. Use cases for transformations include fast real-time analytics, data movement, disastor recovery in Hadoop, data integration, fast batch, and database load/off-load. Key focus will be on integrating Hadoop with various systems including Message Systems, File Systems, and Databases. Users should be able to connect to any source and any destination from within Hadoop. Ability to leverage any user code as part of the connections and transformations. We expect to develop a strong community that has a deep influence on big data ecosystem.

Examples of Messaging Systems include ActiveMQ, Flume, JMS, Kafka, Kinesis Streams, MapR Streams, Nifi, RabbitMQ, Solace, ZeroMQ, etc.

Examples of File Systems include HDFS, FTP, NFS, S3, SFTP, MapR-FS etc.

Examples of Databases/Stores include Accumulo, AeroSpike, Cassandra, CouchDb, MongoDB, HBase, Couchbase, Geode, HBase, Hive Tables, MapR-DB, Impala, JDBC, HP Vertica, MemCache, MemSql, MySql, Oracle, Redis, etc.

Examples of protocols include AMPQ, HTTP, MQTT, SMTP, Rest/Soap, Twitter, Websockets, etc.

Other connectors include ElasticSearch, Splunk, Solr etc.

Our events will include production customer who will present their use cases.
results.name: Big Data (native Hadoop) Ingest and Transform, Boston

results.description: The National Health Federation Official Website: www.thenhf.com In the 1950s we fought and won the battle for mandatory inspection of poultry. In the 1960s we coordinated a major drive to help chiropractors become legally licensed in over 40 states. In the 1970s we waged very successful campaigns against fluoridation. In the 1980s we pushed through legislative recognition of acupuncture. In the 1990s we lobbied to pass the Dietary Supplement Health and Education Act S-784, fought malathion spraying, promoted public education on the dangers of vaccinations, and continued fighting the fluoridation battle. In the 2000s we are working to prevent the Codex attempts to restrict your freedom to take vitamins and minerals and we are currently taking action to defeat the Senator Durbin Bill (S.722) that seeks to restrict DSHEA with his move to require dietary supplement manufacturers to submit Adverse Event Reports, to institute a pre-approval process with the FDA for all dietary supplements that are stimulants, and to re-classify anabolic-steroid dietary supplements as Controlled Substances. The other NHF battles include opposing S.1780, S.1538, H.R. 207 and H.R. 3377 (considered the Son of Durbin bill). We are also supporting health-promoting legislation such as the Access To Medical Treatment Act and a repeal of the Kefauver Amendment of 1962 that gave the FDA expanded authority over drug “efficacy” and thus the ability to play favorites with drug companies. We are fighting alongside other countries against a major health freedom threat, one whose goal is to harmonize vitamin and supplement laws that strictly regulate natural health foods worldwide.
results.name: The National Health Federation/Boston, MA.

results.description:
Boston Bodhi Meditation is located at 101 Mystic Avenue, Medford, MA 02155, Tel: (781)874-1023.

Bodhi Meditation has been serving the greater Boston area since 2010. We offer free meditation group practice. We understand that the pressures and tolls in our everyday life drain us. Various life challenges not only create stress, but also throw our mental, emotion and bodily functions out of balance. As a result, it manifests into various diseases. We welcome all to come and participate in Bodhi Meditation to promote self-cultivation, dispelling stress and strengthening mental state. We invite all who are interested in learning and practicing meditation to optimize one’s health and achieve a vibrant and balanced life.

Bodhi Meditation is accessible and practical. It encourages the attainment of happiness through its teachings of positive approaches. There are three main approaches: dynamic meditation (Meditation of Greater Illumination), sitting meditation (Meditation of Purity), and healing energy. This process leads to the accumulation of positive karma.

Bodhi Meditation is the product of Meditation Master JinBodhi's 18 years of traditional meditation training. It enhances physical and psychological health. It offers free therapeutic guided meditation for the benefit of every individual as well as for the promotion of a globally compassionate society. Master JinBodhi rose from humble origins on the Qinghai-Tibetan Plateau. Through the profound nature of his own enlightenment, he has become known as one of the greatest meditation masters of our times. Due to his effective approach, known as Bodhi Meditation, millions have already studied and benefited from these practices.

Meditation Q & A

Testimonials from our participants:

It is so nice to have such an opportunity to attend these Bodhi meditation sessions.  It gives me an opportunity to take a break from our hectic lives and to recharge and to relax.   It helps me to be able to let go of the insignificant things in my life and and concentrate on the big picture.                                                                                                                By Lee 

I began my meditation journey about two years ago with skepticism.  I wasn't sure if I could sit still and find a calming place to relax. To my surprise, it only took three sessions! I can now meditate without being fidgety, or letting my mind wonder! Bodhi Meditation has taught me to slow down in life and I have found an inner peace when I practice.  My instructors, Sharon and Daphne have been truly wonderful, through their kindness and patience in their teachings.  I feel I have  more balance  in my life when I meditate, not to mention greater focus and more energy.  I have also witness the healing power of meditation when suffering from different types of physical ailments.  Through my practice, I have gained inner wisdom on how to handle every day stress.  I would definitely recommend this program, as I have experienced first hand the benefits of such an inspirational practice.                                                                                                                               By Jadine
