results.description:
Before you roll your eyes at yet another local business group on Meetup, consider this... NO business cards. NO name tags. NO elevator pitches. NO embroidered polo shirts with your logo. NO awkward circles of suits clutching their coffees. Heck, don't even bother wearing a suit to my events. (Still reading this? Sweet, there's more . . . )

• • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • •

If I hear the phrase "Business Mixer" one more time, I might be sick. Just kidding, or maybe not? But isn't it always the same 10 people showing up with their eager handshakes, eating the same greasy appetizers, and drinking the same bottle of chardonnay? If that's your cup of tea, then knock yourself out.

Personally, I want something different.

Being a new mom has opened my eyes to many things. Some are too gross to share here, but one of the main things that I've come to value is . . . TIME.

Holy crap . . . how humbling (and nerve-racking) is the reality of TIME? It's an unstoppable, non-negotiable force that keeps slipping through our fingers. The tighter you grasp at it the more it slips out of your hand.

I am done wasting TIME at random business meetings, listening to the same stories, surrounding myself with empty smiles. I'd rather play toy trains with my toddler for 10 hours than spend 10 minutes at yet another basic business meeting.

"Stop complaining, Jessica, and doing something about it!"

Yep, that's right. Instead of being the type of naysayer that sits in the stands, pointing my finger and critiquing the archaic networking efforts of others . . . I'm going to design my own type of networking event.

Say hello to Spark! Networkers — Speed Networking with a TWIST.

Here's a quick rundown . . .

• Gather together at a new location once a month (for now). <br>• Delicious eats and treats. Cash bar. <br>• Again—no business cards, no name tags, no professional labels. <br>• Structure the event similar to speed networking. <br>• The meeting is organized, timed, and efficient. <br>• Each (registered) participant will be assigned a number. <br>

But what's the TWIST?

That part will be kept "hush hush" until you attend your first event. You'll have to come and experience it for yourself.

No matter what, I will promise . . .

• No awkward silences and blank stares. <br>• No standing in the corner glued to your phone. <br>• Authentic conversation that makes you come alive. <br>• Truthful reactions — instinctive + emotional. <br>• Genuine connection with yourself and others. <br>• A unique and unforgettable evening.

Why bother?

I've specialized in graphic design for over 10 years and I'm the first to say that no matter how awesome your logo is or how "put together" your branding might be . . . NO ONE is going to do business with you unless they trust (and like) you, as a person.

Nowadays, people see right through the pretty fonts and modern color schemes. You might make an awesome first impression with people, but if you're a total jerk, good luck getting new clients (and friends).

There are pros and cons with business groups and chambers today. For me, the cons outweigh the pros. Of the hundreds of people I've met over the years, there were only a handful with whom I truly felt connected. Everyone else became just another superficial connection on LinkedIn or simply forgotten. Sad, but true.

Spark! Networkers is my reaction. It's my experiment. It's my mission.

Strip away the professional labels. Eliminate the fakeness. Remove boring conversation that barely scratches the surface. Instead, bring passionate business owners together. Ignite an immediate connection. Cultivate healthy and sustainable relationships. Share our real personality, our desires, our fears . . . our humanity.

Is all this possible in just one night of networking? Who's knows? But we're going to find out, regardless. I invite you to join me, and all the other "outside of the box" thinkers.

No membership fees. My events are FREE (for the time being) with registration required.

Come with an open mind, and leave with a full heart.

Warmly, <br>Jessica Brand

p.s.

This is not a space for recruiting new contacts or adding people to your email list. Since we're not exchanging business cards, you won't be able to receive anyone's email or phone number without their permission.

Spark! Networkers is not a club for singles looking to mingle. Basically, if you make more than one person feel uncomfortable, I'll have to respectfully block you from the group.

If you reserve a seat at our events and not show up (without prior notice), I'll be bummed. If you do it again, I'll happily remove you from the group. Thanks for your understanding!

results.description: Learn how NOT to bore MBA admissions directors. This is a Meetup for anyone interested in applying for an MBA, reapplicants, and those who've already applied, but need help navigating the MBA application process. We also welcome MBA students and graduates interested in networking with each other and/or MBA applicants. When it comes to MBA apps, we tell it like it is and don't rely on tips/advice you've already read/seen/heard about all over the internet and in other MBA groups. We plan on keeping our meetups informative and fun, so will have drinks and refreshments and time for networking at each of our gatherings. Our group is also open to anyone interested in the MBA process in general, entrepreneurs, and those considering the startup path. We will meet to discuss the do's and don't's of the MBA application process, and will provide detailed guidance on what admissions look for - especially the top 5 schools. The Meetup is led by Christina Björnström (http://bit.ly/1URSLqC), an MBA admissions consulting veteran, who's helped countless students get into top MBA programs including those with low GMAT scores, low GPAs, and minimal extracurriculars. Christina is joined by MIT alum and fellow entrepreneur Sohan Shen (http://bit.ly/1UPL1GW).
results.name: Boston MBA Applicants and Alums Networking

Steriti Memorial Rink is located in Boston's historic North End. The rink is a short walk from the T's North Station (Green and Orange Lines) and from the North End's excellent restaurants and bars. results.description:
EL PLANETA MEDIA & WORKBAR CAMBRIDGE ARE PLEASED TO ANNOUNCE 

POWER UNDER 30 | Networking Event 

Celebrating the achievements of young entrepreneurs and leaders who are starting to make a difference in the Hispanic Community in the Commonwealth

This is what networking events are supposed to be about: getting together with people who are passionate about what they do! The Power Under 30 is an agenda-free style event where people are welcome to show up and celebrate 16 stars on the rise under 30 years of age. The Power Under 30 is an intimate event in preparation for the 12th edition of the Powermeter. The Power Under 30 will take place at the WorkBar Cambridge location, just a few steps away from the Central Sq. T station. 


When: April 8th | 6pm-8pm 

Where: 45 Prospect Street, Cambridge, MA, 02139 

Light snacks and beer will be available (please bring valid ID). 

Admission is free! Please sign up soon, space is limited. 


Come and meet stars on the rise and check out the WorkBar office space for your own business! ABOUT Every year the Powermeter 100 publishes the “Future Powermeter List” naming 16 powerful young people who are starting to make a difference for the Hispanic Community in Massachusetts. The “Future Powermeters” are people under 30 years of age who are up and coming in different fields. They are stars on the rise and might accomplish great things in the near future. 

ABOUT THE HOSTS: 

El Planeta Media: 14 years serving the Hispanic Community in Massachusetts and devoted to the importance of this community as a growing audience with an escalated purchasing power and undeniable multicultural professional and educational development. Media channels include print weekly edition, TV, online and events.

 WorkBar Cambridge: Workbar is a popular local co-working and shared office space company with approximately 25 locations across Boston. Workbar is an ecosystem of startups, small businesses, independent professionals, and remote teams to do your best work. They provide spaces for a variety of companies and individuals to work in a communal, shared office spaces. 



                          For more information contact events@elplaneta.com or call 617-840-3711
results.name: Power Under 30 | Networking Event

results.description:
Wouldn't you like more lucrative referrals for your business?

Partners Boston is Boston's hassle-free networking community for small business owners. WHO WE ARE. Don't you agree that building your business is bold and challenging? Isn't it smart to build life-long relationships, but how do you find them? At company events? A random internet search? We believe in better. We actively seek the leading specialists in their careers and interview them. We seek people who are people centered. Who center their business on relationship building. Who actively listen and care. From legal and accounting to benefits and HR support; from banking and bookkeeping to strategic planning, small business owners, and startups. We're well connected and we work for you.
Meet our team of specialists and discover how we can help you and your business.
Partners Boston is well respected, exclusive, and highly demanded. To make our community noncompetitive (among members), only one person per business type is allowed. You can e-mail me with you business information and I will let you know if there is an opening for your business.

You are welcome to drop in for a visit. To attend please use this Meetup site or send me a direct email through Meetup and let us know how many seats to reserve for your party. Send us an email and we can discuss if we have an opening for your profession, or you can check out our web site PartnersBoston.com

Search our member list to see if your category is open, then visit a meeting and lock out your competition!

Come for our meeting -- stay for the referrals!

We anticipate you joining us,
Josh and Partners
results.name: Partners Boston Business Referral Community
